Text.Value: Hello, Death. I like your hat.
What a fool you are. You cannot kill me - I am eternal.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Bruised and beaten, Ketheric clutches his hurt abdomen while breathing heavily. His other arm hangs limply to the side

Text.Value: He is watching. He is listening. He is... he is...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Ketheric (Normal) looks up as if hearing a voice
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Eldritch whispers as if speaking to Ketheric.

Text.Value: I am Myrkul, Lord of Bones, and you have slain my Chosen.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Myrkul] Starts to rise from the pool. [Player] Slowly leans forward to make out what the shape is <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The light grows brighter as a mist rises from the mist - something is forming within it.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Loud boom as fire bursts up.
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Glow of pool becoming brighter. Smoke and mist rise up to the heavens, fully obscurring the rising Myrkul. Hints of shape of movement could only be seen

Text.Value: Well, fuck.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ketheric transforming into the Apostle of Myrkul

EditorData.stateContext:
Ketheric off-screen

Myrkul transition has begun

Text.Value: No... there is no repentance... no release. My debt can never be repaid.
Tsk'va!
The Triad help us...
For I am Death. And I am not the end - I am a beginning.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Myrkul] Extendes his left hand and summon his scythe. [Player] stares up, aghast. <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The Apostle form emerges from the VFX display and hefts its scythe, preparing for combat
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Burst and crackle of fire as Myrkul emerges. Metallic vibrations as scythe moves to unstick itself. Sounds of thunder as camera focuses on the sharp blade. Then a metallic whoosh as scythe slices through the air.
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Burst of flame shoots out as Myrkul emerges from the smoke. Magical glow and sparkle around scythe as it is summoned. Light glints over the sharp edge of scythe. Wisps of magic surround scythe as it flies through the air.

Text.Value: Shit.
Myrkul... Lord of Bones. I am here. I am ready.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Ketheric (Injured) looks up as if hearing a voice.
EditorData.NodeContext: Invoking the god despite being battered and broken
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Eldritch whispers as if speaking to Ketheric.

Text.Value: I am the smile of the worm-cleansed skull. I am the regrets of those who remain, and the restlessness of those who are gone.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Still looks at pool in rising dread and horror<TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul.
EditorData.NodeContext: This should now be Myrkul's voice rather than Ketheric's. Will require SFX processing
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Flames build up again as Myrkul starts his monologue. Smoke keeps pouring out from the pool, obscuring anything within
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Deep rumble builds up. Something’s definitely happening

Text.Value: By Mystra's silken tresses...
I am the haunt of mausoleums, the god of graves and age, of dust and dusk.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Slowly backs away, looking around in fear and suspense <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul. A light glows from within.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Deep rumble builds up. Something’s definitely happening
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] A glow coming from the pool.

Text.Value: You dare end one who belongs to me?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Runs towards the edge of the pool, peering down to see what's within <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Sounds of fire and deep rumble as if something is building up in the pool
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Flames die down, thick smoke curls upwards

Text.Value: Oh. Oh dear.

EditorData.NodeContext: Just watched your enemy transform into a monsterous avatar of death. It's not looking good.

Text.Value: But it is no matter.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Myrkul] Almost fully out of the pool. [Player] Recoils back in surprise and horror <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The light grows brighter as a mist rises from the mist - something is forming within it.
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Thick smoke obscuring a vague figure. Glow from pool grows brighter

Text.Value: He is here.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Ketheric] Staggers backwards to the edge of the pool. then falls backwards in it[Player] Steps forth and reaches out as if to stop him. <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: *Ketheric staggers, gripped by some unseen power, and falls into the brine pool.*
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] A fiery blast as flames erupted from the brine pool. Another whoosh as Ketheric falls into the pool
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Fire and smoke erupts from the brine pool. A particularly bright flare with sparks and extra smoke that envelopes Ketheric as he falls in

Text.Value: By Silvanus' mossy beard...
I am yours.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Katheric] Same as N4, but in injured state [Player] *DUPE* from N4 <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: *Ketheric staggers, gripped by some unseen power, and falls into the brine pool.*
EditorData.NodeContext: Invoking the god despite being battered and broken
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Eldritch whispers as if speaking to Ketheric. A fiery blast as flames erupted from the brine pool. Another whoosh as Ketheric falls into the pool
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-211018] Fire and smoke erupts from the brine pool. A particularly bright flare with sparks and extra smoke that envelopes Ketheric as he falls in

Synopsis: This dialog shows Ketheric transforming into his second phase - the Apostle of Myrkul. This can either happen by beating Ketheric in his first phase or by convincing Ketheric of the error in his ways, provided the right conditions are met.
